{"role":"user","content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "cf9147e14e69125d3547b0ad2ddd647f035991af",
    "filename": "docs/external-id/customers/how-to-azure-monitor.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-azure-monitor.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-azure-monitor.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fhow-to-azure-monitor.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -23,8 +23,8 @@ When you plan to transfer external tenant logs to different monitoring solutions\n \n ## Deployment overview\n \n-The external tenant uses [Microsoft Entra monitoring](/entra/identity/monitoring-health/overview-monitoring-health). Unlike Microsoft Entra tenants, an external tenant can't have a subscription associated with it. So, we need to take extra steps to enable the integration between external tenant and Log Analytics, which is where we send the logs.\n-To enable [Diagnostic settings](/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/diagnostic-settings) in workforce tenant within your external tenant, you use [Azure Lighthouse](/azure/lighthouse/overview) to [delegate a resource](/azure/lighthouse/concepts/architecture), which allows your external tenant (the **Service Provider**) to manage a workforce tenant (the **Customer**) resource.\n+The external tenant uses [Microsoft Entra monitoring](/entra/identity/monitoring-health/overview-monitoring-health). Unlike Microsoft Entra workforce tenants, an external tenant can't have a subscription associated with it. So, we need to take extra steps to enable the integration between the external tenant and Log Analytics in the workforce tenant, which is where we send the logs.\n+To enable [Diagnostic settings](/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/diagnostic-settings) in the workforce tenant, use [Azure Lighthouse](/azure/lighthouse/overview). Azure Lighthouse [delegates the resource](/azure/lighthouse/concepts/architecture), allowing the external tenant (the **Service Provider**) to manage the resource in the workforce tenant (the **Customer**).\n \n > [!TIP]\n > Azure Lighthouse is typically used to manage resources for multiple customers. However, it can also be used to simplify cross-tenant administration [within an enterprise that has multiple Microsoft Entra tenants of its own](/azure/lighthouse/concepts/enterprise). In our case, we're using it to delegate management of a single resource group."
  },
  {
    "sha": "2d853bf9d21198738dadbe49822838319e7c6bb7",

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-check-web-content-filtering-categories.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-check-web-content-filtering-categories.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -1,5 +1,5 @@\n ---\n-title: Check web content filtering categories\n+title: Check web content filtering categories (preview)\n description: Use the web category checker to find which web content category a URL belongs to via Microsoft Graph.\n author: fgomulka\n ms.author: frankgomulka\n@@ -10,7 +10,7 @@ ms.custom: sfi-image-nochange\n ai-usage: ai-assisted\n ---\n \n-# Check web categories with the web category checker tool\n+# Check web categories with the web category checker tool (preview)\n \n The article shows how to use the web category checker tool to determine which content category a given Uniform Resource Locator (URL) belongs to. The tool is currently available only via Microsoft Graph API.\n "
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-export-connector-logs.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -106,7 +106,7 @@ To enable verbose logging:\n     1. Download the Azure Arc agent setup script from the Azure portal.\n     1. Search for **Windows PowerShell ISE** in the search box on the Task bar. Right click on the application, then click **Run as administrator**.  \n     From PowerShell, open the downloaded file labeled `OnboardingScript.ps1`. \n-    1. Run the script. You can bypass the execution policy if needed by running: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass - File \"FilePath\" \n+    1. Run the script. You can bypass the execution policy if needed by running: powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File \"FilePath\" \n     1. Log in on the pop-up window to authenticate using the Azure account credentials. The screen returns a message that reads:\n     `Authentication complete. You can return to the application. Feel free to close this browser tab.`\n \n@@ -119,8 +119,7 @@ To enable verbose logging:\n     \n ### Set up Log Analytics workspace\n 1. Go to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/).\n-2. Create a Data Collection Endpoint \n-3. Create a Log Analytics workspace: \n+2. Create a Log Analytics workspace: \n     1. In the search bar, type **Log Analytics** and select **Log Analytics workspaces**.\n     1. Click **Create**.\n     1. Fill in the necessary details:\n@@ -129,7 +128,7 @@ To enable verbose logging:\n        - **Name**: Provide a unique name for the Log Analytics workspace.\n        - **Region**: Choose the region closest to your on-premises machine.\n     1. Click **Review + create**, then **Create**.\n-4. Create a table under the new workspace. \n+3. Create a table under the new workspace. \n \t1. Select the workspace name you created. \n \t1. Navigate to **Workspace** > ** **Settings** > **Tables**. \n \t1. Click **+ Create** > **New Custom Log (Direct Ingest)**."
  },

    "sha": "e446f127997996b961fe1a92eef1f05584506043",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/how-to-source-ip-restoration.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 4,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 5,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-source-ip-restoration.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-source-ip-restoration.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-source-ip-restoration.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -3,7 +3,7 @@ title: Enable Source IP Restoration with Global Secure Access\n description: Learn how to enable source IP restoration to ensure the source IP matches in downstream resources.\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 02/21/2025\n+ms.date: 09/30/2025\n ms.author: kenwith\n author: kenwith\n manager: dougeby\n@@ -21,6 +21,9 @@ Source IP restoration in Global Secure Access allows backward compatibility for\n - [Microsoft Entra ID Protection risk detections](/entra/id-protection/concept-identity-protection-risks) get a consistent view of original user Source IP address for assessing various risk scores.\n - Original user Source IP is also made available in [Microsoft Entra sign-in logs](/azure/active-directory/reports-monitoring/concept-all-sign-ins) and in [Microsoft Entra audit logs](/entra/identity/monitoring-health/concept-audit-logs)\n \n+> [!NOTE]\n+> To achieve source IP restoration for non-Microsoft apps, you must also configure Conditional Access policies and ensure traffic flows through a compliant network. To learn more, see [Enable compliant network check with Conditional Access](/entra/global-secure-access/how-to-compliant-network#protect-your-resources-behind-the-compliant-network).\n+\n ## Prerequisites\n \n * Administrators who interact with **Global Secure Access** features must have both of the following role assignments depending on the tasks they're performing."
  },

    "patch": "@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ manager: mwongerapk\n ms.author: henrymbugua\n ms.service: identity-platform\n ms.topic: tutorial\n-ms.date: 01/27/2025\n+ms.date: 09/30/2025\n ms.custom:\n \n #Customer intent: As a developer, I want to authenticate users from a sample Android mobile app so that I can experience how Microsoft Entra External ID\n@@ -69,7 +69,7 @@ You must configure specific redirect URIs in your app registration to ensure com\n \n ### [External tenant](#tab/external-tenant)\n \n-[!INCLUDE [Add platform redirect URI](../external-id/customers/includes/register-app/add-platform-redirect-url-ios.md)]\n+[!INCLUDE [Add platform redirect URI](../external-id/customers/includes/register-app/add-platform-redirect-url-android.md)]\n \n ### Enable public client flow \n \n@@ -116,7 +116,7 @@ You pass the required tenant identifiers, such as the application (client) ID, t\n  \n Use these steps to create configuration file:\n \n-#### [Workforce tenant configuration](#tab/android-workforce)\n+#### [Workforce tenant configuration](#tab/workforce-tenant)\n \n 1. In Android Studio's project pane, navigate to **app\\src\\main\\res**.\n 1. Right-click **res** and choose **New** > **Directory**. Enter `raw` as the new directory name and select **OK**.\n@@ -177,7 +177,7 @@ b) Update AndroidManifest.xml. In the app go to **app** > **src** > **main** > *\n    You can find these values in the Authentication blade of your app registration as well.\n \n \n-#### [External tenant configuration](#tab/android-external)\n+#### [External tenant configuration](#tab/external-tenant)\n \n \n 1. In Android Studio's project pane, navigate to *app\\src\\main\\res*.  \n@@ -231,7 +231,7 @@ b) Update AndroidManifest.xml. In the app go to **app** > **src** > **main** > *\n \n To initialize MSAL SDK instance, use the following code:\n \n-#### [Workforce tenant configuration](#tab/android-workforce)\n+#### [Workforce tenant configuration](#tab/workforce-tenant)\n \n ```java\n PublicClientApplication.createSingleAccountPublicClientApplication(\n@@ -257,7 +257,7 @@ PublicClientApplication.createSingleAccountPublicClientApplication(\n This code creates a single account public client application using the configuration file auth_config_single_account.json. When the application is successfully created, it assigns the instance to `mSingleAccountApp` and calls the `loadAccount()` method. If an error occurs during the creation, it handles the error by calling the displayError(exception) method.\n \n \n-#### [External tenant configuration](#tab/android-external)\n+#### [External tenant configuration](#tab/external-tenant)\n \n ```kotlin\n private suspend fun initClient(): ISingleAccountPublicClientApplication = withContext(Dispatchers.IO) {"

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Fhow-to-preserve-original-organizational-unit.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -56,13 +56,13 @@ You can also store the OU information in some other attribute like *info* or any\n Use PowerShell or Microsoft Graph Explorer to verify the attribute sync.\n  \n \n-- **PowerShell (Microsoft Graph SDK)**\n+- **Microsoft Graph PowerShell**\n \n   ```powershell\n   Get-MgGroup -GroupId <groupId> | Select -ExpandProperty OnPremisesExtensionAttributes \n   ```\n \n-- **Microsoft Graph Explorer**\n+- **Graph Explorer**\n \n   ```https\n   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{group-id}?$select=onPremisesExtensionAttributes "
  },
  {
    "sha": "0f7e6513677982ea9d0508359a7b00daf656b0db",
    "filename": "docs/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/tutorial-group-provisioning.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 78,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 80,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Ftutorial-group-provisioning.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Ftutorial-group-provisioning.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fhybrid%2Fcloud-sync%2Ftutorial-group-provisioning.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: omondiatieno\n manager: mwongerapk\n ms.service: entra-id\n ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 08/04/2025\n+ms.date: 09/19/2025\n ms.subservice: hybrid-cloud-sync\n ms.author: jomondi\n ms.custom: no-azure-ad-ps-ref, sfi-image-nochange\n@@ -52,6 +52,82 @@ To add synced users, follow these steps:\n 9. It should successfully add the user to the group.\n 10. On the far left, select **All groups**. Repeat this process by using the **Sales** group, and add **Lola Jacobson** to that group.\n \n+## Prepare groups for Group SOA conversion and provisioning\n+\n+You can preserve the original organizational unit (OU) of on-premises groups and provision the groups back to their original Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) after you convert Group SOA to the cloud. Complete the following steps to prepare the groups for provisioning to AD DS with their original OU path.\n+\n+### Change the group scope for the AD DS groups to Universal\n+\n+1. Open Active Directory Administrative Center.\n+1. Right-click a group, click **Properties**.\n+1. In the **Group** section, select **Universal** as the group scope.\n+1. Click **Save**.\n+\n+### Populate a custom attribute in AD DS\n+\n+You can store the OU path in a custom attribute or any other attribute like *info*. For more information about how to sync custom attributes, see [Custom attribute mapping](/entra/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/tutorial-directory-extension-group-provisioning). In this example, the OU oath is stored in *extensionAttribute13*.\n+\n+Run the following cmdlet to extract the OU from each group's distinguished name (DN) and store it in the *extensionAttribute13* attribute. \n+\n+```powershell\n+Get-ADGroup -Filter * -SearchBase \"DC=contoso,DC=com\" | ForEach-Object { \n+    $ou = ($_.DistinguishedName -split \",\", 2)[1]  # Extract OU path \n+    Set-ADGroup -Identity $_.DistinguishedName -Replace @{extensionAttribute13 = $ou} \n+} \n+```\n+\n+### Enable sync for the custom attribute in the sync client\n+\n+1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as at least an [Hybrid Identity Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#hybrid-identity-administrator).\n+1. Browse to **Identity** > **Provisioning** > **Cloud Sync**. \n+1. Select your Cloud Sync configuration. \n+1. Under **Attribute Mapping**, for Group objects: \n+   1. Click **Edit Mapping** \n+   1. Add a new mapping: \n+\n+     | Setting | Value |\n+     |---------|-------|\n+     | Source attribute | extensionAttribute13 |\n+     | Target attribute | onPremisesExtensionAttributes.extensionAttribute13|\n+     | Match objects | Leave unchecked |\n+     | Apply this mapping | Always |\n+\n+### Confirm the custom attribute sync in Microsoft Entra ID\n+\n+   #### [**Microsoft Graph PowerShell**](#tab/PowerShell)\n+\n+   ```powershell\n+   Get-MgGroup -GroupId <groupId> | Select -ExpandProperty OnPremisesExtensionAttributes \n+   ```\n+\n+   #### [**Graph Explorer**](#tab/GE)\n+\n+   ```https\n+   GET https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/groups/{group-id}?$select=onPremisesExtensionAttributes \n+   ```\n+\n+   You should see: \n+\n+   ```https\n+   { \n+     \"onPremisesExtensionAttributes\": { \n+       \"extensionAttribute13\": \"OU=Finance,DC=contoso,DC=com\" \n+     } \n+   } \n+   ```\n+   ---\n+\n+### Provision SOA converted groups with the custom attribute\n+\n+When you configure **Provisioning**, use the synced attribute to control the target OU. \n+ \n+1. In your **Provisioning** configuration, map onPremisesExtensionAttributes.extensionAttribute13 to a custom variable such as *preferredOU*. \n+2. Use an expression like this example to handle fallback. This expression uses the original OU if it's available, or falls back to a default OU that you specify. You can change extensionAttribute13 later to override the value. \n+\n+   ```\n+   IIF(IsNullOrEmpty([extensionAttribute13]), \"OU=<Enter your default OU name>,DC=contoso,DC=com\", [extensionAttribute13]) \n+   ```\n+\n ## Configure provisioning\n \n To configure provisioning, follow these steps:\n@@ -74,7 +150,7 @@ To configure provisioning, follow these steps:\n \n    9. There are two possible approaches to set the OU:\n \n-      - You can preserve the original OU path from on-premises. With this approach, you need to set the attribute mapping based on an extensionAttribute value. For more information, see [Preserve the original OU path](how-to-preserve-original-organizational-unit.md).\n+      - You can preserve the original OU path from on-premises. With this approach, you first need to [Prepare groups for Group SOA conversion and provisioning](#prepare-groups-for-group-soa-conversion-and-provisioning).\n    \n       Or\n "
  },

    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 0,

    "changes": 3,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -24,9 +24,6 @@ For important details on what this service does, how it works, and frequently as\n ::: zone-end\n \n ::: zone pivot=\"cross-cloud-synchronization\"\n-> [!IMPORTANT]\n-> Cross-cloud synchronization is currently in PREVIEW.\n-> This information relates to a prerelease product that may be substantially modified before it's released. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.\n \n This article describes the steps to configure cross-tenant synchronization between Microsoft clouds. When configured, Microsoft Entra ID automatically provisions and de-provisions B2B users in your target tenant. While this tutorial focuses on synchronizing identities from the commercial cloud --> US Government, the same steps apply for Government --> Commercial and Commercial --> China.\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "eb37c8098daa40e185420b9396cfd3a130514ab3",
    "filename": "docs/identity/multi-tenant-organizations/cross-tenant-synchronization-overview.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-overview.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-overview.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fmulti-tenant-organizations%2Fcross-tenant-synchronization-overview.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -139,7 +139,7 @@ Within the same cloud, which clouds can cross-tenant synchronization be used in?\n \n Is [cross-cloud synchronization](cross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md?pivots=cross-cloud-synchronization) supported?\n \n-- Cross-cloud synchronization (such as public cloud to Azure Government) is currently in public preview.\n+- Yes, cross-cloud synchronization (such as public cloud to Azure Government) is supported.\n - For information about the relationship between the Azure Cloud environments and Microsoft 365 (GCC, GCCH), see [Microsoft 365 integration](/azure/security/fundamentals/feature-availability#microsoft-365-integration). \n \n What cloud pairs are supported for cross-cloud synchronization?"
  },
  {
    "sha": "8ab3dcce8f1cbd6ce15ae94625ae1c2d07e4f868",
    "filename": "docs/includes/automatic-redemption-include.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fincludes%2Fautomatic-redemption-include.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d/docs%2Fincludes%2Fautomatic-redemption-include.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fincludes%2Fautomatic-redemption-include.md?ref=cf89b3f8d00b59d3622d5613322c8442f59a8a1d",
    "patch": "@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ The following table shows how this setting compares when enabled for these scena\n | Users must accept a [consent prompt](~/external-id/redemption-experience.md#consent-experience-for-the-guest) | No | No | No |\n | Users receive a [B2B collaboration notification email](~/external-id/redemption-experience.md#automatic-redemption-process-setting) | No | Yes | N/A |\n \n-This setting doesn't impact application consent experiences. For more information, see [Consent experience for applications in Microsoft Entra ID](~/identity-platform/application-consent-experience.md). This setting is supported for organizations across different Microsoft cloud environments, such as Azure commercial and Azure Government, but is currently in preview. For more information, see [Configure cross-tenant synchronization](../identity/multi-tenant-organizations/cross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md?pivots=cross-cloud-synchronization).\n+This setting doesn't impact application consent experiences. For more information, see [Consent experience for applications in Microsoft Entra ID](~/identity-platform/application-consent-experience.md). This setting is supported for organizations across different Microsoft cloud environments, such as Azure commercial and Azure Government. For more information, see [Configure cross-tenant synchronization](../identity/multi-tenant-organizations/cross-tenant-synchronization-configure.md?pivots=cross-cloud-synchronization).\n \n #### When is consent prompt suppressed?\n "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the recent changes:

The documentation has been updated to reflect the preview status of web content filtering categories and to clarify the use of Azure Lighthouse for managing external tenant logs. Minor corrections have been made to PowerShell command execution and Log Analytics workspace setup.

Further enhancements include updating the date for enabling source IP restoration and adding a note about necessary Conditional Access policies for non-Microsoft apps. The Android mobile app tutorial has been refined with updated tab names and redirect URI inclusion.

Changes were also made to streamline the documentation for preserving original organisational unit paths during group provisioning in Microsoft Entra Cloud Sync and to update the status of cross-cloud synchronization. Finally, a note regarding the preview status of automatic redemption across different Microsoft cloud environments has been adjusted.

message:

Fix numbering and formatting in export logs documentation

Click **Review + create**, then **Create**.\n-4. Create a table under the new workspace. \n+3. Create a table under the new workspace. \n \t1. Select the workspace name you created. \n \t1. Navigate to **Workspace** > ** **Settings** > **Tables**. \n \t1. Click **+ Create** > **New Custom Log (Direct Ingest)**."
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
The commit modifies the documentation for exporting connector logs in Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access.

Key changes include:

*   A minor correction in the PowerShell command for bypassing execution policy, changing `- File` to `-File`.
*   Streamlined the steps for setting up a Log Analytics workspace by removing a redundant instruction to create a Data Collection Endpoint before creating the workspace.
*   Corrected numbering in the "Set up Log Analytics workspace" section, with the creation of a Log Analytics workspace now being step 2, and the creation of a table under the workspace becoming step 3.
